I'm seeking someone in the 32-40 age range. Also, I'd prefer if she was reasonably well educated and engaged in professional careers. I'm a fit, active person, and I'd prefer someone who is similarly inclined (runner, yogi practitioner, etc.), or at least fits into the "HWP" category. There are some other characteristics that I value, but they seem rather generic and subjective: sense of humor, literacy, taste in music, books, wine, etc. 

Finally, I won't try to meet you in person, nor will I inflict unsolicited pictures of my genitalia on you. I'll just be a regular, nice guy.

title: Professor Seeks Bookworm
text:
It's almost 9pm on a Saturday night and there's nothing to do. Most of the other twenty-somethings and thirty-somethings are going out to the bars and clubs. You could go too; perhaps your friends have invited you to go out with them; but it's really not your thing. What you wish most of all was that the library was open. A really nice library, with cozy chairs, hardwood floors, area rugs, and real wooden bookshelves. But at this time of night, all of the libraries are closed and locked. Apparently nobody likes to read a Saturday night.

Still, you like to fantasize. You like to imagine yourself walking through the aisles, pausing ever so briefly each time one of your familiar favorites catches your eye: Austen, Bronte, Dickens, Dickinson, Faulkner, Hemingway, Hugo, Joyce. . . Just seeing the names brings a smile to your face as you recall the pleasures that their words have given you over the years. You've already read almost everything by the great ones, but there is always something more. Another treat to savor. Those last few Shakespeare plays you've never read. Or one of Vladimir Nabokov's more obscure novels from his Russian period. Or Finnegans Wake. No, not Finnegans Wake. You need something that will satisfy tonight, not next year. How about an Emily Dickinson poem? Yes.

You pull a book off the shelf, open to a random page, and continue slowly walking down the aisle as you read the words

Master--open
your life wide, and
take me in forever,
I will never be tired--
I will never be noisy
when you want to be
still--I will be
your best little
girl--

Suddenly, not looking where you are going, you walk right smack into a man. A tall man in a corduroy blazer and dark rimmed glasses. A man who is probably at least ten years older than you, if not more. A man who is surprisingly fit and attractive in a college professor sort of way. Where did he come from? This is your library. Your dream. Your imagination. You thought you were alone. Embarrassed and flustered, you apologize and quickly turn around to head in the other direction.

"The library is closed. What are you doing here? How did you get in here?" His voice is deep and smooth. Strong. And as he speaks, he places a firm hand on your shoulder.

"What are you reading?" he asks as he steps closer and places his other hand on your other shoulder. You wonder what kind of dream this is. You can feel his eyes as they read the words on the page

nobody else will see me, but you--
but that is enough--
I shall not want any more--

His big hands begin to slide down your arms, and you can feel your breath quickening. You notice a simple gold band on his finger, and your eyes fixate on it as he takes the book from you, closes it, and places it on the shelf.

You turn around to face him, and you raise your head until the two of you are looking directly into each other's eyes. An academic man and a young scholar. A common love for literature. A quiet place to share each other's interests.

Perhaps we should continue the discussion in a real library?

title: This is a serious request
text:
And so, with all of the divisive talk about race and ethnicity in this years political debate, and a video that I saw on Facebook, I had an Ephipany. 

I don't have any people who are Caucasian, Hispanic, or other than African American that I would consider true friends. To be clear, we may work together or smile and walk by one another on the street. 
How can this be in one of the most multi-cultural cities in the world? 
And so, the only way for this deficit in my life to change is for me to aggressively try to diversify my friendships. This is a strictly platonic request. I love discussing politics (we can agree to disagree if necessary), hearing about the international travel of others, grabbing a beer or glass of wine, supporting the nonprofit community, going out dancing, listening to live music, trying new restaurants on H street and the Navy Yard (I'm open to other areas), and. hitting a few golf balls on the range (although I'm a novice). I'm a non-practicing Catholic from the Midwest. I'm pretty well educated (Masters) and I believe that laughter is central to getting through life. 

I don't know if we have anything in common, but I'd welcome the opportunity to meet with you on an upcoming sunny 70 degree day and discuss it. 

Hmm...have you asked yourself.. Do you welcome diversity in your life?

title: Young Professional Wants More Out of Life
text:
Hello all, 

Quick stats: 31/m, Brown Hair, Blue Eyes (Glasses), 5'5", and on the chubby end for mammals. 

Quick story: 18 year old kid knew everything there was to know. Couldn't be bothered to listen to anyone because he had grown up earlier than most (and sadly that's the truth), so naturally, he married the first woman he had sex with because he was a "good Christian" and astoundingly stupid. 

Flash forward six years. After working nonstop, dropping out of his Senior year at college, and divorce on the horizon (he was a terrible husband, but she should have kept taking the anti-depressants, it might have helped), a new chapter opened up. 

Lost a lot of weight. Then lost his job because in 2011, no one needed another "Best Buy" knockoff store in Colorado. Moved to Texas and then met another woman. Kind, responsible, and really good for this man. 

Unfortunately, in 2013, a brain tumor shredded the marriage. He had life saving surgery, but became epileptic (not a big deal), but the couple were never as close again as the stress of paying for neurosurgery, her Master's Degree, and his recovery was just too much to bear. 

They are still together and they are fast friends who do a lot together, but the romance is gone and the man is on what he calls "autopilot". And their problems aren't related to talking. They almost over share. Both know how the other fills, but romantically: round peg, square hole. 

So, here we are. She's finishing her degree, loving her job in DC, he put back on a lot of the weight (not all of it) and goes to therapy.

Surprise, the man is me! 

I'm looking for friends. I've always gotten along with women more. Not exactly looking romantically, but is not going to stop if it's right (which is horrible, but attempting to be completely honest). I have lots of interesting thoughts, discussions, love funny people, want to go out and dance, will watch a movie in the theater every single weekend and enjoy football as well as comic books. Also love kids and dogs. Have two dogs myself. Sadly no kids and it's a tough call if my other half wants that. 

Want to talk? Grab coffee? Write a screenplay together? Watch the sunrise or set? Act crazy at a dance club we don't belong in? Or just watch movies in the theater or my place (I work from home)? 

Hope you are out there looking for the same. You never know, maybe two people are wishing on the same star. 

Alejandro

PS: if you've read this far, please help me with easy deletions by putting a type vegetable in your subject line. Thanks.

title: MC County: Searching 4 unlicensed coach for relationship counseling
text:
I am seeking a counselor/coach type person -- female only -- and almost surely unlicensed, for discussion and dialog about relationships. But I seek a situation where you are comfortable with me being undressed, fully exposed, during our meetings and discussion. That's not allowed for licensed counselors/therapists, but unlicensed persons have more flexibility. I enjoy talking through my life issues with someone creative and empathic, and in particular am seeking relationship counseling. I am not seeking sex. But physical exposure and expression facilitates verbal revealing.

I have posted before, and have found someone very helpful to talk to, whom I do see on occasion. But I could benefit from additional dialog, and I'd prefer someone closer to home, which for me means Montgomery County. I'd prefer a location in or close to Montgomery County -- upper NW DC is okay, as is nearby PG county.

I am a single man, middle-aged. Apart from discussion about relationships and dating, you'll find that in such other conversation as naturally arises, I'm intelligent, curious, well-educated, thoughtful. I can be pretty funny at times.

I'd prefer contacts from counselors/coaches who are at least 30 or older, though a bit younger are welcome to make contact. But generally, more experience with life and dating, and closer to my experience, is likely to work better. In deep or personal conversations, I'm usually more at ease with white or Asian women (no disrespect to others, it's just my cultural base); but I am open to women of other ethnicities making contact and seeing where the mutual comfort level is. 

If you answer, please tell me about anything that you've done that's even kind of related -- former therapists and graduate students in counseling are encouraged to reply. But really any articulate, insightful, empathic woman may be right -- a businesswoman, an academic, military, also a massage therapist, nurses, female bartenders, or even an escort (but once again I am not seeking sex here, not intercourse or oral or any such thing here) -- someone with experience in listening to people on the job, may be right for this and for me.

Along with exploring relationship issues, this sort of experience is a chance for me to feel acceptance and companionship in the company of a woman. It's necessary that you be comfortable with a naked man, but also with possible arousal. I emphasize that there would be no sex, and that the conversation and dialog and coaching are a very real part of this, and very important to me. 

If interested, write to me and I can tell you more about what I'm seeking. I will offer reasonable hourly remuneration for your counseling, coaching and listening skills, and for the environment of acceptance you create. ($50/hour, possibly more, negotiable.) Please confirm your age and also confirm that you can host. 

If you're comfortable with it, you can provide a rough indication of where you are located. I would hope, if it works out, that this would be a once or twice a month type experience, ongoing for some time. I am really seeking someone in Montgomery County, MD.

I am not seeking a "Domme." A real counselor, even unlicensed, is still someone whom I pay, but who builds a genuine, personal connection, in the sense of really getting to know me and wanting to help me improve my life. If the connection works, a counselor/coach really develops a genuine concern for a client, and can, in a sense, celebrate with the client whatever progress the client makes in improving the quality of his life. I am seeking the kind of human bonding, support and connection that comes from a real counselor. If you are a Domme, either in private life or professionally, you'd probably be comfortable with all this, and I'd welcome hearing from you; but I am not seeking that side of your personality (nor your dungeon space).

Put 'Anna Freud' in the subject line to filter out spam.

title: How to write a great cl ad.
text:
First, Craigslist is the sewer of on line dating. That said, there are opportunities to help you out.
1. Put in your physical description. A real one. This is the most important thing for male attraction. Don't use words like "curvy". Use real measurements like height and weight. Don't bother saying you are cute. That is up to us to decide.
2. If you skipped #1, go back and do that. There is another reason. Not including a description is what spam bots do. 
3. Don't mention wanting a ltr or "serious guys only". Every ltr starts off with a first date and most end right there. No shortcuts or spoilers. Take your chances and see what happens.
4. Don't mention your degree. Guys don't care. You are just wasting words.
5. Keep it short. Include just the basics, not your life story. The longer it is, the less likely anyone will read all of it. 
6. If you have a type of guy you prefer (age, body, race) then say so. Don't say "race doesn't matter". If you do, you just excluded the 2/3 of men for whom race does matter. And it doesn't matter if you say this because guys of all races will respond anyway.
7. Don't post in casual encounters. That is all spam bots so real men won't even read your ad. 
8. If you post in platonic section, don't say things like ,"friends first then more later". That's guy code for, "just sex". 

Good luck to you all.

title: MC Cnty: Searching 4 unlicensed coach for relationship counseling
text:
I am seeking a counselor/coach type person -- female only -- and almost surely unlicensed, for discussion and dialog about relationships. But I seek a situation where you are comfortable with me being undressed, fully exposed, during our meetings and discussion. That's not allowed for licensed counselors/therapists, but unlicensed persons have more flexibility. I enjoy talking through my life issues with someone creative and empathic, and in particular am seeking relationship counseling. I am not seeking sex. But physical exposure and expression facilitates verbal revealing.

I have posted before, and have found someone very helpful to talk to, whom I do see on occasion. But I could benefit from additional dialog, and I'd prefer someone closer to home, which for me means Montgomery County. I'd prefer a location in or close to Montgomery County -- upper NW DC is okay, as is nearby PG county.

I am a single man, middle-aged. Apart from discussion about relationships and dating, you'll find that in such other conversation as naturally arises, I'm intelligent, curious, well-educated, thoughtful. I can be pretty funny at times. 

I'd prefer contacts from counselors/coaches who are at least 30 or older, though a bit younger are welcome to make contact. But generally, more experience with life and dating, and closer to my experience, is likely to work better. In deep or personal conversations, I'm usually more at ease with white or Asian women (no disrespect to others, it's just my cultural base); but I am open to women of other ethnicities making contact and seeing where the mutual comfort level is. 

If you answer, please tell me about anything that you've done that's even kind of related -- former therapists and graduate students in counseling are encouraged to reply. But really any articulate, insightful, empathic woman may be right -- a businesswoman, an academic, military, also a massage therapist, nurses, female bartenders, or even an escort (but once again I am not seeking sex here, not intercourse or oral or any such thing here) -- someone with experience in listening to people on the job, may be right for this and for me.

Along with exploring relationship issues, this sort of experience is a chance for me to feel acceptance and companionship in the company of a woman. It's necessary that you be comfortable with a naked man, but also with possible arousal. I emphasize that there would be no sex, and that the conversation and dialog and coaching are a very real part of this, and very important to me. 

If interested, write to me and I can tell you more about what I'm seeking. I will offer reasonable hourly remuneration for your counseling, coaching and listening skills, and for the environment of acceptance you create. ($50/hour, possibly more, negotiable.) Please confirm your age and also confirm that you can host. 

If you're comfortable with it, you can provide a rough indication of where you are located. I would hope, if it works out, that this would be a once or twice a month type experience, ongoing for some time. I am really seeking someone in Montgomery County, MD.

I am not seeking a "Domme." A real counselor, even unlicensed, is still someone whom I pay, but who builds a genuine, personal connection, in the sense of really getting to know me and wanting to help me improve my life. If the connection works, a counselor/coach really develops a genuine concern for a client, and can, in a sense, celebrate with the client whatever progress the client makes in improving the quality of his life. I am seeking the kind of human bonding, support and connection that comes from a real counselor. If you are a Domme, either in private life or professionally, you'd probably be comfortable with all this, and I'd welcome hearing from you; but I am not seeking that side of your personality (nor your dungeon space).

Put 'Anna Freud' in the subject line to filter out spam.

I am white (your ethnicity doesn't matter to me), 41, professional, keeping things together quite well compared to my peers, athletic, fun, intelligent, emotionally and mentally stable and secure, get my share of attention but never act on it and I want to find a friend who is outside of my own social and professional circles for obvious reasons.

title: Seeking cuddles, offering cookies...and expecting zero clicks on this
text:
I realize this endeavor has about as much a chance of success as my getting a job at Hooters (these A-minuses I'm rocking are clearly not going to blow anyone's doors off. . .or anything else, for that matter), but, well, worth a shot, right? I mean, it IS Craigslist. . .there are weirdos on here. Like me.

So, what brings me into this den of interweb weirdos? There's no way to say this without sounding douchey, so I'll just say it douchily (that's a word, right?): I need a cuddle. And I'm married.

Yes, I should theoretically get all the cuddling I need at home. But, sadly, circumstances in life seem to be conspiring against that happening, and it's been a long time (years?) since cuddling for the sake of cuddling happened, without all of the attendant pressures and stresses of life intruding on the moment. And I miss that. I miss what it feels like to just get lost in the moment snuggling with someone, feeling them pressed against you, smelling the scent of their hair, just reveling in being close and connected. 

I know what you're thinking--"Hey, dirty old married guy. . .you really just want skeezy sex, but are trying to disguise it as something innocent." That's what I'd be thinking, too, if I were you. I assure you I'm not, but this is CL, and there are weirdos (like me), so why would you believe me?
Hmm. This may be an insurmountable obstacle. Nonetheless, let's press forward. All of you who are no longer reading might be interested. Or not. Since you're no longer reading.

I'm a 36-year-old white professional with brown hair and blue eyes; 5'9"; 150 pounds; generally pretty good smelling. Pretty good at cuddling (by my own reckoning, at least. . .perhaps that doesn't qualify as a ringing third-party endorsement). And I really want to just get lost, if even for an hour, in being close to someone, snuggling with someone, spooning, holding, etc. Life has been incredibly stressful lately, and that sort of contact sounds so relaxing, so amazingly therapeutic. . .sigh.

I know there are services for this sort of thing, and I've inquired, but haven't had any luck finding anyone who's schedule is compatible or who's close enough to make it work. And, it seems weird to pay for that sort of thing (not that I'm opposed to it), as it feels much better when the other person is just as eager to hold and be held. 

So, what am I looking for? Someone who wants the same thing (I should say a lady who wants the same thing. . .sorry, gents; nothing personal). Someone who's ideally available during the day and can host our snuggling. Someone who has a good sense of humor and will look at this the same way I do: a therapeutic modality that will give us both an escape from the stress of life for a little bit, and a chance connect with someone. 

I realize there's exactly 0 people out there who will fit that description, but there's always hope, right? Let me sweeten the pot: I WILL BRING COOKIES! Or whatever baked good tickles your pickle boat (is that a thing?). How can you say no to THAT? 

We could always meet for coffee or something beforehand, too, just to see if we feel like we want to proceed. Snuggling is intimate, and it might be weird to just show up and say, "Hey, nice to meet you, little spoon! Get over here!"

If that sounds remotely interesting, I'd love to hear from you. . .I shan't hold my breath, though, as I'm not very good at that anyway. ;)

(Oh, and for those wondering...I really just do mean cookies. Apparently, as I've learned somewhat awkwardly, that word can mean something else on CL...)

Kathy is my little secret that I am keeping from her. I love my girlfriend, but I am cheating on her. She doesn't know Kathy, but Kathy knows her; she walks by her almost everyday. 

Kathy's lovemaking makes me feel like I want to do a cartwheel, and even though she knows I can't be tamed, she is always ready to give me some good loving. text:
This just in!! Sixty-three year old white male seeks friend!! 



Who knows a poem by heart! (I don't know that many, but one is below.)



Bonus points if by Emily Dickinson or William Shakespeare!! 




What you might like to know about me: 

I am posting here to avoid creeps and for decorum's sake.

I am legally separated, not yet divorced, after a long marriage that was without romance for the last fifteen years. I am still in the family home with separate quarters. The nest is almost empty.

I believe in love

I am still told I look like Harrison Ford, (or how he used to look!)


Things I would like about you: 



You love your kids. 



You are athletic. 



You have a job. 



You like your job 



Therapy has helped you over the years 



You've been on a sailboat 



You like to laugh 



You and your siblings are friends. (And it wasn't always easy to be.)



You don't have a pit bull.



You don't find this posting too affected, or at least you understand that I have to say something while being reserved.


You are still told you look like Catherine Deneuve (or how she used to look!). (JK)


When I have fears that I may cease to be
Before my pen has gleaned my teeming brain,
Before high-piled books, in charactery,
Hold like rich garners the full ripened grain;
When I behold, upon the night's starred face,
Huge cloudy symbols of a high romance,
And think that I may never live to trace
Their shadows with the magic hand of chance;
And when I feel, fair creature of an hour,
That I shall never look upon thee more,
Never have relish in the faery power
Of unreflecting love--then on the shore
Of the wide world I stand alone, and think
Till love and fame to nothingness do sink.

title: * PART-TIME ENTREPRENEUR *
text:
Have you ever felt like something was just not right with the world? As if you've been living a lie? If you ever seen The Matrix movies, then you know what I'm talking about.

Not saying that we all live in a computer generated world, but I do believe that metaphorically speaking, we do live in a Matrix. Some of the realities are created by other people, organizations and institutions. . .others are created by our own perception of things.

We've been conditioned to believe that only the 'lucky ones' achieve their dreams. . .that only a chosen few will be able to do what they want, when they want and with whom they want.

I call b.s. on that!

Because I have been awakened and I 'unplugged' from the Matrix, I see the world in abundance instead of lack. Now, are there real-life real-world problems out here? Absolutely! But don't get it twisted. . .we each have the power to make major changes in the world. . .but it starts with empowering ourselves, first and foremost.

With the help of fellow empowering part-time (and full-time) entrepreneurs, I get to impact thousands of people's lives from anywhere I choose as long as I have an internet connection.

If you are still reading this, then you may be the person I'm looking to lock arms with. But before I continue, let's take a trip down memory lane. . .

I was born in D.C., but grew up in Hampton Virginia. Growing up, the focus in my family was to go to school, get good grades, and find a high paying job. Pursing my passions was secondary to making sure I had education that would at least land me a safe and secure job.

You and I both know that there is no such thing as job security. And even if there was such a thing. . .it does not guarantee FINANCIAL security. As I learned in Robert Kiyosaki's book Rich Dad Poor Dad, it's not about how much you make, but how much you KEEP.

But I digress. . .so, through most of my scholastic years, I had been an honor roll student. It wasn't until my freshman year at James Madison University did I experience my first major failure. . .long story short; I got academically suspended and could not return for a calendar year.

I felt like a loser. . .how does one go from an A-B honor student to academic suspension? On the outside looking in, it would appear that the only way it could happen is from me simply not caring at all about my education...and that was far from the truth.

It was a shock to my ego, I'll admit. My friends asked were my parents furious at me because I failed so miserably. It was a surprise (even for me) to find out that they weren't furious at all. Perhaps disappointed, but that is my guess because they never expressed disappointment with me for doing so poorly in college.

But this goes a back to the Matrix thing. . ..my perception was that I was a loser, a failure, and that my parents were disappointed with me. . .all because of the expectations I had set for myself.

Fast-forward to 1996, when I decided to serve in the U.S. Navy after a year off from school and working a part-time job as a dessert prep/dishwasher. 

I basically still owed tuition to JMU as well has had to start paying back on the student loan (which wasn't even enough to cover the full tuition in the first place). Most of my buddies had gone into the service in other branches, so I figured the military couldn't be that bad.

I had a great time in the military; traveling the world, meeting different kinds of people. . .little did I know that this experience planted the seed of traveling as a lifestyle. Some of the places I traveled to were Colombia, Jamaica, Venezuela, Aruba, Germany, England, Denmark, Halifax and many more!

I used the time in the Navy to pay off my student debt as well as learn some skills in advanced electronics. I got honorably discharged after serving six years of service. After serving my time I decided to come back home to Virginia.

In 2002, I began work as a shipbuilder, doing electrician work. In the following years, I went from working outside in the elements to being in a climate-controlled cubicle. You would've thought I had 'made it.'

That was far from the truth.

I was not fulfilled.

I witnessed first-hand the office politics and was not down with it.

I have always been a free-spirited person. I do not do well with rules that don't make sense to me. To blindly do things just because 'they said so' never flew with me...especially when I found better ways of doing things.

I soon realized that just because it makes sense, doesn't necessarily mean that we're doing it that way. . .it seemed as if less things made more sense, the more we did them.

Have you had this experience at your job? If so, then you can feel my pain, lol.

It wasn't until after reading Rich Dad Poor Dad in 2007 did the "entrepreneurial bug" bit me. I knew there was more to life than working the 40-40-40 Plan (40 hours a week, for 40 years only to get a retirement check 40% of what I'm making now. . .which wasn't enough in the first place), but did not know exactly how to go about looking.

Reading that book opened my eyes to how the money game actually works. I found out why the rich get richer, the poor get poorer and why the middle-class is getting wiped out.

I made a DECISION to make a change.

It was time to let go of the old ways of thinking I had adopted from my elders (no fault of theirs. . .they didn't know what they didn't know and did the best they could with what they had, and I thank them for it).

After a brief dabble into real estate investing, I got introduced to the home based business industry. . .I've been hooked ever since. Now, it didn't come without challenges; and I've had my fair share. 

To name a few:
-I racked up over $70,000 in debt
-I lost my home to foreclosure
-I got my car repossessed twice in a year
-I got my lights shut off every 3 months for a year

As you can see, even though I was making decent money, I wasn't keeping much of it. A lot of it went to over-draft fees, late fees, living beyond my means via credit cards, etc.

I was pretty reckless with my money. I'm sure you know a couple of folks who've been reckless with their funds as well.

There are a lot of things I want to do. I have dreams of becoming financially free; to travel the world and learn different cultures; to take cruises and spend days on the beaches of the world under blue skies and palm trees.

I want to create MY OWN economy without having to depend on a job to do these things. . .and I don't want to have to wait 40 years to save up, only to have the freedom, but not the body to enjoy my freedom, if you know what I mean, lol.

And the best part of creating wealth is the ability to give more. I'm not breaking the bank (yet) but I have tasted what I felt like to earn income leveraging the internet in a way that I don't have to be present for every transaction.

I am building a business while having a life!

I'm not ashamed to say that I currently still work my 9-5, because I know that if my company were to let me go that I already have something in place working for me on my behalf (even as I type this message you're reading).

To have that peace of mind is priceless! I can now go to work without the stress. . .I can deal with the politics because I know that these shenanigans are temporary.

If you want to know more about my challenges and how I overcame them, feel free to add me as a friend on FB; holla at me:
https://www.facebook.com/valentinocrawford

Send me a message and tell me what YOUR DREAMS are and how making an extra income online will help you and your family.

I do read all of my FB messages because I do care. . .but I cannot want something for you more than yourself. I'm not the type to think I'm too good to answer messages. I was once in your shoes and I remember where I came from.

Your future self and your dreams are waiting for you; when will you make a decision meet up with them?

Peace,
~Valentino
https://www.facebook.com/valentinocrawford

title: Friends that hit it off
text:
Well, like most friendship ad posts, I am probably looking for a unicorn, but here goes anyway. One thing I've noticed about deep friendships is that they are usually only likely with peers from similar backgrounds, so I am attempting here to give some idea of who I am -- other than "I like shopping, going to movies, eating out." (I mean, who doesn't?) 

With that said, I am married with grown kids. I sometimes find single women not to be compatible with me. It doesn't mean we can't be, but when someone is fervently looking for someone special, being around someone who is already attached seems to get in the way of their personal happiness. OTOH, if someone is content with their relationship status, we tend to gel as friends. Because of my situation, I have free time during the day, so I am looking for someone who also has that freedom. Like almost everyone, I have an opinion about politics, but I dislike being around people who are on either end of the political spectrum. I enjoy social drinking. I enjoy working out. I'm not interested in being someone's motivation for getting into shape, so please don't befriend me with that in mind. I tend not to get along with passive-aggressive personality types over the long term. They are too emotionally shut down to be real with. I like being active, especially with all the wonderful places/things in DC to see/do. I like occasional random texting with people who have a dry, witty sense of humor. I enjoy cooking my own meals and eating fairly healthy, although I'm not maniacal about it. (That doesn't mean I don't like to eat out sometimes.) I don't usually hit it off with super-touchy, easily offended types. If you are that unicorn, maybe we can hang out while searching for that pot of gold at the end of a rainbow. No sexual trolls, please

title: To each their own...
text:
Ladies,

Are there certain sides to you or even things that you secretly like but are too shy, afraid or embarrassed to admit to the people you're close to because of the feeling that they'll misjudge you or start looking at you differently, think that you're weird because of what you like and/or don't like? Is there anything that you would like to do with someone or would want someone to do for you but in your mind you feel that whatever it is may creep them out or that they will immediately decline because of whatever the request or desire may entail? Feel that others will not ever truly understand and accept the real you so you keep the real you hidden within?

Well fear not... you are not alone. I'm just like you. I love meeting new people and will gladly share my interests, passions and desires with anyone who is willing to listen and accept me for who I am and what I like and/or dislike. I do not judge others for their quirks and I certainly try not to knock something before trying it. After all, you could end up liking or disliking it too and can therfore see things from another person's point of view.

With that said, ladies please feel free to send a reply. Don't be shy. Let's be friends and get to know the real us through one another. title: We are medical refugees
text:
Hello Land of the Free! You don't even know how much you've been missed.

This is a request. Or maybe... several requests.

First off, if you are not familiar with a lot of the new research that been established, please take some time to do so.

The National Institutes of Health has determined by way of PATENT 6630507 the MANY benefits and potential benefits of the cannabis plant. To understand why this is not more widely available information- would be a completely different task... but not at all separate , so please, pick whatever ways and means suit you best. Just please don't be uninformed anymore...

That being said, we are medical refugees, not political refugees. Not yet anyway. Again, that would be an environment that I do not have experience in. I try to stay informed as best I can while also remembering that there are usually two sides to every story- and somewhere in the middle is often where the truth will lie. And the further away you are from an event- the less you will actually know about it. So I'm not too far away from... NIH... or a politician that actually seems to be ' getting it ' , along with the integrity to back up her words. As I am grateful for that, unfortunately, we are not close enough.

We are just across the river. Strange that I've been here almost my entire life- but don't think I know anybody on the other side. And a nuisance to try due to the high traffic and expense that it has always been to visit Our Nation's Capitol- again, an argument that I am only prepared to complain about- with no authority or expertise to make much more of a concise argument other than ' I don't like it. '. But along with any of those arguments, as an ordinary citizen, I can sense a large political divide between the neighboring areas. Even within my own Commonwealth, which is significantly larger than the D and the M portions of this tri state ( DMV ) area put together. From my experience as a constitute of Northern Virginia for so long, I would bet that there would be very little progress towards some of the initiatives that have already been established (and in the Districts recent case, trailblazed) in the neighboring States concerning the use of medical cannabis.

In my advancing years, I have always served myself and learned what works best for me- , mentally and environmentally- as people generally do while... living their lives... furnishing their homes, choosing their careers, cooking their food, deciding what to wear, investing, raising their children and voting, etc. I have realized the benefits that cannabis has provided for me while struggling with anxiety, ADHD, and the side effects of the medications typically used to treat these disorders - even prior to the research of the benefits of cannabis used for these conditions was established. But the issue has never been raised in the Commonwealth on any significant scale outside mostly just conversations amongst like minded people. So I include myself in that, shake my head a lot and go on serving myself and my family.

A couple of years ago, my daughter presented with severe inflammation in all parts of her eye and into intra cranial hypertension- essentially diagnosed as idiopathic. The doctors believe that it is considered an auto immune disorder- which in many aspects is also considered idiopathic. And the ' treatments ' of many auto immune disorders are pretty intense, including chemotherapy and other immune suppressant pharmaceuticals that have less than a couple of decades worth of research backing them. After a couple of years of these treatments - with no real improvement- it seems as if the experts are satisfied with 'maintaining', slowing the progression of, or prolonging what they idiopathically THINK is inevitable.

While conducting my own research, my daughter's conditions are collectively considered ' secondary glaucoma '- a condition that has been treated with cannabis for a very long time.

And with the recent discoveries made in the properties of the cannabis plant that reduce inflammation and treat autoimmune disorders, it would be only logical for me to want to try this method for my daughter who has had no success with pharmaceutical treatments- but only negative side effects.

The cannabis plant has also been proven to alleviate the negative side effects of chemotherapy- so again, why wouldn't I want to pursue this treatment for my daughter? 

And why anyone would engage me in a debate while my daughter is going blind?

Because the research is in. Many of the beneficial properties of the cannabis plant do not even include the THC component- the part that produces the 'high' that many people associate with the cannabis plant. And of course, these patients do not generally get their medication in a form that they have to smoke.

As a desperate parent, I have conducted some rather intensive research on how to help my child. I discovered a few ' loopholes ' in order to get my daughter approved as a medical marijuana patient. Which, with the help of a few more progressive States- I was essentially able to accomplish... but only as close as Oregon. Which seems a bit absurd to me if I can't even afford a trip across the river...

In this trying economy, it has been challenging for just about everyone. Especially for those who were financially disadvantaged to begin with. About the worst time imaginable to be dealing with a chronic and idiopathic disease. Particularly with the enormous cost of specialists and medications... that AREN'T working!!! 

Because of all of this now, along with some other life changing events, I have essentially found myself homeless- although I have been established in Northern Virginia almost my entire life, I have been able to survive with a little help from my friends.

My primary focus of course is my daughter's health.

A move across the river would probably not be too inconceivable- although I do not have the means ( finances, credit or contacts ) in the District to get myself established. Nor do I feel that I have the luxury of establishing a 1 year residency in order to get the help that I need. I understand The District of Colombia has an enormous homeless population. I don't see where I could get much help going from being homeless in a place where I am familiar and established to being homeless in a place where I know no one or have nothing.

I am- aside from having the obligations of caring for my daughter, essentially- employable in any of my previous occupational fields- and anxious to resume whatever kind of normalcy I can achieve given our current circumstances. What I am asking for here is a chance at that possibility.

If there is anyone, anyone at all- that can... relate... or possibly assist in any way- I am open to any suggestion.

I am a 44 year old, single mom- with no criminal history whatsoever, just trying to help my daughter lead a normal, healthy life.

I am open to ideas, information, leads, employment and the opportunity to meet anyone in a position that could possibly help... or who may need some help- in exchange for a usable address in Washington DC so that I can try to save my daughter's vision.

In the meantime, thank you for your attention and good health to all. Regardless of your zip code.

Hopefully

title: Introverted nurse seeks similar longtime friend
text:
Hello!

Although Craigslist isn't the ideal place to find friends, when you're an introvert who has absolutely no social activities they engage in it is pretty much your only option (as far as I know they haven't made a Tinder for best friends for life yet). So it's a little awkward but it's worth a shot. 

I'm 22 year old white female nurse. I'm happily married with no kids (although we are trying to have one...so somebody in a similar life stage would be awesome). I'm an avid pole dancing enthusiast (have been out of practice the past few months but working on getting back into it.) and enjoy shooting at the NRA range (I'm a newbie but it's fun!). I also enjoy reading when I get the time and of course all the things that most girls love: shopping, getting my nails done, eating out, etc etc. I'm very driven in my career and would prefer to meet someone who also takes their career seriously. I watch very little TV, and I think there is a lot of more productive things you can do then sit in front of the tube. I identify as bisexual but I really just looking for a friend. I did the fwb route and it really just ended in a lot of heartache, so instead of having a fwb who may last for a little while, I'd prefer to develop a friendship that lasts a lifetime. 

In a friend I'm looking for someone who is preferably attached (married, engaged, etc) as I have had more success in the past with friends who aren't "on the prowl" so to speak. Like I said earlier in my ad, my husband and I are trying to conceive so someone in a similar life stage would be nice. Other than that, I just ask that you be intelligent, be able to hold a conversation, mature, honest, driven in whatever it is you do in life, and open minded. Let's be fun/silly/quirky together. I have a flexible work schedule that allows me a lot of time during the week to do things (perks of being a nurse!). I want someone who would be just as content to come over to my house and watch/help me organize a room as they would be going out to the mall together. It seems true friendship is rare these days but if I could just have one truly good friend, I would be happy. I don't want someone who is super clingy and needs constant attention, but having someone to chat with on a daily ish basis would be cool. 

Send me a bit about yourself (more than one line please!!), what you're looking for, and a picture (helps to know who you're talking to). I'd preferably like to text/email back and forth a bit before we met as I am introverted, but once you get to know me I'm loud, fun and quirky. I'm the subject line put your favorite movie. Mine is Silence of the Lambs. 

Looking for in a similar age range as me too 20-35? 

I'm curious to see what the Craigslist gods bring me :D



No men. No couples. No mouth breathers. Thank you!

title: Wanted: BFF
text:
I have almost everything I could want in life except a female best friend. I don't usually get along with with other females because I usually am just one of the guys. If you've felt this way, read on.

I'm sassy. I'm crass. I like to laugh (loudly). I make fun of people and don't mind being ribbed in return. I dance like no one is looking all the time. I talk to strangers regularly. I'm a people person. I enjoy impromptu get togethers. I'm also a pierced, dyed haired (sometimes), big geek at my core, not because it's "in" right now but because that's what generally interest me. I could care less if you wear makeup and fashionable clothes and care more about if you're fun and a good person. I also identify as a kinkster. I won't impose it on but feel if I really want to find a good friend, it's something they should know since it's a part of me.

My fave things are...
Netflix binge sessions
Planning my zombie apocalypse escape plan
Aimless current event talking with music playing in the background
On the fly mini road trips

If any of this sounds like you or you're looking for this type of friend then you should write me. I'm a loyal and dependable friend and most of my circle of friends I've known for years. I'm just hoping to add a ballsy female like myself to my group.

Want to know more? I'm happy to share. Just shoot me a message and we'll get chatting. I don't mind taking some time to get to know you online before meeting but am not looking for endless emailing. If you're into drama, self-loathing, being flakey (read: being excessively late to things ugh), and generally making everything about you, we most definitely shouldn't cross paths. Also I'd like to find someone who doesn't have children (more flexibility) and isn't entirely new to this area as I don't like playing tour guide/

Well rounded girls, fellow kinkster girls, and geek girls get quicker responses. Hope to hear from you!

As of 2/9/16 I've gone to the Sculpture Garden about 35 times since it opened for the season on 11/14/15. I love the exhilaration and pleasure that ice skating brings. After skating, we could stop into the cafe which is adjacent to the rink.

These days/times are best for me. Just let me know what works for you.

Monday evenings 7:00-9:00PM 
Tuesday mornings, afternoons or evenings 
Wednesday mornings, afternoons or evenings 
Friday evenings 7-9, 8-10, or 9-11 
Saturday evenings 7-9, 8-10, or 9-11 
Sunday evenings 7-9 

I'm single--very fit, healthy, fun and have a youthful look and mindset. I guess I'm an intermediate skater -- way beyond a beginner but nowhere near an expert. I live in Old Town, Alexandria. title: Are You Lonely? Do You Feel Alone?

Anyone else out there feeling troubled, lonely, or alone? Maybe we can talk and meet, and can help each other through this. I could use a close friend, and I'm open to more if anything develops, but it isn't necessary unless it works for both of us.

I have lost touch with most of my relatives, or in some cases, they have passed away. Most of my closer friends have moved away, or are at previous workplaces or part of activities that I no longer participate.

I have met a few people on CL or at various places throughout the DMV, but no real friendships or relationships have materialized. I've been surprised that so many people have hidden agendas. It has been disappointing.

I'm open to meeting anyone and your personal situation doesn't matter, as long as you are really looking to meet and spend time with a potential good friend, boyfriend, and/or lover in me. I'm not looking for an extended email exchange, so the sooner we can meet, the better. Let's work through this and build something special together. Your age, race, religion, etc. doesn't matter either.....I relate well to all and am very flexible and open minded. I only ask that you are serious about trying this, and are clean and DDF.

title: MIAMI BEACH TO WASHINGTON DC, NEWLY RELOCATED, PEACE AND POSITIVITY.
text:
**Hello, 
My name is Ryan. This note, this message to you is written from a new juncture in my life, a juncture that requires that I require more of myself. It is not lost on me, the understanding that working, whether it is for oneself or as part of an organization, what is most commonly referred to as "work" is a requirement to sustain life and flourish in this societal structure. My point of focus in this commentary is the feeling of not wanting to be just another member of the "rat-race" for the sake of working alone, especially when that work calls into question my integrity or moral compass. I am of the opinion that there should be meaning and the ability to make a measurable positive impact, a real contribution. The scale is not as significant as being able to look back at the end of a day, at the end of a week and at the end of my tenure and say and feel that I have been a part of a great team and great organization and we have had a positive impact. My interaction, my contribution, my energy and effort left someone or some organization better off than when we started. I also yearn for an organization that has a track record of merit based forward progression in terms of increased responsibility, diversity of opportunity and upward mobility within the organization. An organization that breeds into the environment a culture and understanding that says that an individuals' energy, resources and creative intellectual property will be recognized and acknowledged with compensation that is commensurate to their contribution to the organization there by providing access to a level of personal security that will allow me to remove all distraction and put my entire self into the task at hand. I would like to and it is my hope that I will find this amalgamation of energy out there in an organization. 

If you are the organization I describe here, it would be an honor to speak with you. Please contact me directly. 

If you have any positive feedback, advice, ideas and resources that would point me in the right direction, please contact me direct. 

For those in tune with and aware of the "alternative", a few facts... I am currently 32 as of this January 19. On the Zodiac spectrum, I am Capricorn Decan 3. On the Chinese Zodiacal spectrum, I am year of the Rat. On the Numerological spectrum, I am Life Path Six. One more for the road, my blood type is AB+.

I am also a still photographer using my own professional equipment (ig: @lifeisaphoto19, fb: photography by ryan r gilbert). I am available to shoot on-location or I have the option of a small in-home studio with available backdrops, lighting and camera/tripod combo to acheive a high quality finish. I welcome any ideas for personal photography projects (modeling and on-location corporate head shots, complete model portfolio sessions, tattoo photography, artistic b/w boudoir, adult entertainment promo photography, pet photography, legacy photography and much more), event photography and any other generally positive opportunities including drum circles and full moon gatherings.

**I posted what is seemingly (and it is) a job posting ad, in the personals section because I would like to use it to draw like minded and like energy individuals to myself. title: Unfulfilled husband seeking unfulfilled wife
text:
Good evening ladies,

I'll try to keep this light. I'm 9 years deep into an unfulfilled marriage. We southerners married young, thinking our flaming hot desire would be all we needed to weather life. But when is that deep, understanding love supposed to set in? The passion has cooled, but I'm still a passionate man.

We're not separating. We have roots together, and beyond the chemistry we understand each other. I know my life is better with her than on my own. I'm missing something, though; there is a disconnect. 

I'm looking for a sympathetic ear. Some one who can listen without already knowing the answer. My ideal is that we can help each other. I can show you what the man sees and thinks, and you help me with her. If you're a super-hero relationship guru, I'll take that, too. But I'd like to connect with someone who has been there or is also in this funk.

About me: I'm 30 years old, masters in engineering, new to NOVA. (I hope I'm using that right.) Conservative family, but very social and accepting. I find stress relief through exercise, but I'm certainly not a marathon runner, muscleman, or ninja.

title: Needle in a Haystack.....
text:
Trying to meet someone on CL has become like finding a needle in a haystack. It shouldn't be so difficult.

I think I have many of the traits that women look for here. I'm honest and sincere; passionate, loving, and caring; kind, friendly, and loyal; independent, intelligent, and attractive; a non-smoker, very light drinker, and D/D free; with a good sense of humor. That all sounds good, right???

However, when I respond to ads, I often get lost in the mass replies that ladies receive. Sometimes, I resend my replies a few days later asking if there is any interest, and I hear that they never saw my first reply.

So many people are scared. Many others are playing games. Add in the lies, deceptions, SPAM, and SCAMs, and it is so hard today to make a connection.....like trying to find a needle in a haystack.

If you are my needle I would love to find you. I want to find a lady that is looking for friendship, someone to do activities with, enjoys the outdoors, likes to cuddle, and would like a little romance when the time is right. Someone that can enjoy the moment, and doesn't have an agenda or is looking for someone to take care of them. Someone that is able to take it as it goes, has faith in us to build a friendship and/or a relationship, without self-imposed pressures.

Tell me a little about yourself so we can get started. Any age, race, religion, personal situation, etc. is welcome to reply. None of it matters to form a friendship, and we'll see where it goes from there. I don't need to see your pic because I care more about who you are rather than what you look like; however, if you want me to send you a pic, I expect you to send me yours first. Please put your favorite dessert in the subject line. If we meet someplace that has it on the menu, I'll buy you a serving of it. Thanks!

Please don't reply if you aren't real or serious, or want to exchange endless emails. I'm very serious about meeting to get to know you in person, and I want nothing to do with joining websites or paying for memberships.

title: True friendship
text:
I'm 50-year-old single Asian woman with no kids. My work brought me to DC three years ago. I'm kind, honest, fun-loving, well-educated, have a curious mind, and cherish friendship. 

I like to hike, jog, read, travel, go to movies, play ping-pong and learn new skills. I lament the good old days at college where you could find good friends without worrying about their true intension and the friendship could be pure and long-lasting. I usually get along with guys. 

At this point of life, I'm hoping to find true male friends who are intelligent, generous, sharing, honest, humorous, have a big heart, non-smoker, drink only socially, can share ups and downs in life, and can offer some good advice in how to be a better person. 

I'm not interested in guys who are married or are just looking for a fling. 

I'd like to be friends with whom are a professional, well groomed, fit, healthy, honest, enjoying hiking, knowledgeable and decent, at the age between 47 ~60, lives in the DMV area. I don't believe in platonic relationship between men and women. If you are currently involved or in a serious relationship, please be true to that person.

When answering this ad, please describe where you live; tell me what qualities you value the most as a good friend. If you wish, you can include your email address or one or two recent photos. 

Scammers, psychopaths and liars: don't bother to write.

title: Seeking a married friend
text:
Please be sure you understand that I'm a happily married man before reading on. I know this is the platonic section, but there are still a lot of non-platonic posts in here.

I found myself today, during a slow stretch at work, browsing my facebook history and reading some of the past activities and messages from friends before I was married. I used to have a good number of female friends in my single days, but, for one reason or another, those friendships faded once I met my wife. 

I know this is natural, but it made me realize how much I miss having female friends in my life...having a female perspective to bounce ideas off of, someone who might enjoy or reciprocate occasional, subtle flirtation in the presence of mutual attraction and just a friend who I can look forward to chatting with and joking around with during the week.

Being that I work from home, I don't really have an opportunity to meet anyone new for a potential friendship, so I'm forced to turn to the internet. 

I'm hoping to meet another married woman who also misses having guy friends to chat with. I'd like to meet someone within 8-10 years of my own age (33) who would enjoy exchanging emails or some form of texts during the day and, when convenient, in the evening. Having a sense of humor is a plus, for sure, as I don't like to take myself too seriously and enjoy a good, witty back and forth. It would also be nice if you are relatively active and fit, as I would enjoy having a work out partner if our locations and schedules align. 

Hope to hear from you!

title: Friends Only....No Really....
text:
So, here goes. I am a MM in NoVa. Married for a long time and plan to stay that way. (those of you who are judgmental can stop reading now).That said, like most long term marriages, there is the strong sense of ennui. that feeling that there is nothing new to talk about, nothing to experience, and so on. My guess is I am not alone. So, if you are in the same situation, not wanting to cheat, but interested in ongoing email exchange with an older gentleman, then perhaps we are a match. I prefer we don't talk about politics, religion or race. Those things turn light conversations into something emotional, friends into foes, and so on. I definitely don't need that! But, everything else is fair game. Want to share lifestories, talk about how your day is going, or maybe rag on your significant other (LOL)? Great, I'm your guy. 

Please be attached and over 40. That way we will have something in common. I really want this to be stress free and a momentary escape from the daily grind. If you are indeed interested, get back to me. I promise you non-judgmental, adult, friendly conversation.

title: It's Just Dinner....and Good Company!
text:
I will be in North Virginia on and off for the next few months, and I am looking for some company. Now, do note this is in the "Strictly Platonic" section...not looking for a hookup, pay-for-play, or a LTR. I live in Texas, and I have no plans of moving from there.

That said, I will be here for work. My schedule will be busy, but it would be nice if a night or two I could have some company. Ideally, someone to meet for dinner, maybe catch some music or a movie...a little downtime with someone who is open to good company for an evening with no strings/expectations.

Ideally, you are between the ages of 50 - 65, educated (or at least intelligent), moderate-to-left leaning, and have a great sense of humor. Patience is a must, because I am only going to be in the area when my company sends me (which should be twice a month, for a week a stretch) and I'll only be available when my work allows. Race/looks do not matter, but personality is key. Be relaxed, interesting and easy-going, and we will get along fine.

Please respond with a little about yourself and what you enjoy doing. And, if you know of a great Italian place (for dinner), you go to the TOP of the list. Love Italian food!!! Please change the title line to your favorite color, and I'll respond to you. Otherwise, I will think you are a canned-meat-product and treat your message as such....

title: Professor Seeks Bookworm
text:
It's almost 9pm on a Saturday night and there's nothing to do. Most of the other twenty-somethings and thirty-somethings are going out to the bars and clubs. You could go too; perhaps your friends have invited you to go out with them; but it's really not your thing. What you wish most of all was that the library was open. A really nice library, with cozy chairs, hardwood floors, area rugs, and real wooden bookshelves. But at this time of night, all of the libraries are closed and locked. Apparently nobody likes to read a Saturday night.

Still, you like to fantasize. You like to imagine yourself walking through the aisles, pausing ever so briefly each time one of your familiar favorites catches your eye: Austen, Bronte, Dickens, Dickinson, Faulkner, Hemingway, Hugo, Joyce. . . Just seeing the names brings a smile to your face as you recall the pleasures that their words have given you over the years. You've already read almost everything by the great ones, but there is always something more. Another treat to savor. Those last few Shakespeare plays you've never read. Or one of Vladimir Nabokov's more obscure novels from his Russian period. Or Finnegans Wake. No, not Finnegans Wake. You need something that will satisfy tonight, not next year. How about an Emily Dickinson poem? Yes.

You pull a book off the shelf, open to a random page, and continue slowly walking down the aisle as you read the words

Master--open
your life wide, and
take me in forever,
I will never be tired--
I will never be noisy
when you want to be
still--I will be
your best little
girl--

Suddenly, not looking where you are going, you walk right smack into a man. A tall man in a corduroy blazer and dark rimmed glasses. A man who is probably at least ten years older than you, if not more. A man who is surprisingly fit and attractive in a college professor sort of way. Where did he come from? This is your library. Your dream. Your imagination. You thought you were alone. Embarrassed and flustered, you apologize and quickly turn around to head in the other direction.

"The library is closed. What are you doing here? How did you get in here?" His voice is deep and smooth. Strong. And as he speaks, he places a firm hand on your shoulder.

"What are you reading?" he asks as he steps closer and places his other hand on your other shoulder. You wonder what kind of dream this is. You can feel his eyes as they read the words on the page

nobody else will see me, but you--
but that is enough--
I shall not want any more--

His big hands begin to slide down your arms, and you can feel your breath quickening. You notice a simple gold band on his finger, and your eyes fixate on it as he takes the book from you, closes it, and places it on the shelf.

You turn around to face him, and you raise your head until the two of you are looking directly into each other's eyes. An academic man and a young scholar. A common love for literature. A quiet place to share each other's interests.

Perhaps we should continue the discussion in a real library?

title: So Sick of Job Hunting....Leads? Advice? Anything!
text:
I hate waking up so incredibly frustrated. I am still job hunting and so stressed and worried. I am six weeks from graduating with my second college degree in social work (bachelors). I can't find a job to save my life. Occasionally I get an interview but I am always beat out by someone else with more experience it seems. There isn't much I can't do. I have the two degrees and I am currently applying to grad school but I NEED TO BE WORKING STEADILY. I went back to school later in life and I worked my ass off and I have a ton of student debt to show for it, but where is the good paying job to show for all this hard work and effort? 

Thankfully I can bartend and I tend to find bartending gigs here and there to stay somewhat afloat but even that is getting harder to find. THREE interviews last week alone. They increasingly want 20 somethings at these places. If anyone has a lead on a bartending job I would appreciate that too. 

Also, I was thinking of printing out some resumes and a brief profile and just handing them out on the street. Anyone that is familiar enough with the area know where I might be best suited to doing this? Is there an area that might increase my odds that someone working for a nonprofit will get my resume? 

Any help, advice, leads, anything is appreciated. I honestly don't know what to do anymore. There is no help available and I am becoming increasingly stressed and depressed by the day. It's hard to keep your head up when rejection is all that's on the menu. 

Thanks for listening.

title: Weird and/or awkward...
text:
Ladies,

Are there certain sides to you or even things that you secretly like but are too shy, afraid or embarrassed to admit to the people you're close to because of the feeling that they'll misjudge you or start looking at you differently, think that you're weird because of what you like and/or don't like? Is there anything that you would like to do with someone or would want someone to do for you but in your mind you feel that whatever it is may creep them out or that they will immediately decline because of whatever the request or desire may entail? Feel that others will not ever truly understand and accept the real you so you keep the real you hidden within?

Well fear not... you are not alone. I'm just like you. I love meeting new people and will gladly share my interests, passions and desires with anyone who is willing to listen and accept me for who I am and what I like and/or dislike. I do not judge others for their quirks and I certainly try not to knock something before trying it. After all, you could end up liking or disliking it too and can therfore see things from another person's point of view.

With that said, ladies please feel free to send a reply. Don't be shy. Let's be friends and get to know the real us through one another. Share with me your personality, your lifestyle, your likes and your dislikes. I will gladly share with you the same. Who knows, maybe I might like and or dislike the same things that you do and vice versa. Let's chat!! :-)

title: Seeking cuddles, offering cookies...and expecting zero clicks on this
text:
I realize this endeavor has about as much a chance of success as my getting a job at Hooters (these A-minuses I'm rocking are clearly not going to blow anyone's doors off. . .or anything else, for that matter), but, well, worth a shot, right? I mean, it IS Craigslist. . .there are weirdos on here. Like me.

So, what brings me into this den of interweb weirdos? There's no way to say this without sounding douchey, so I'll just say it douchily (that's a word, right?): I need a cuddle. And I'm married.

Yes, I should theoretically get all the cuddling I need at home. But, sadly, circumstances in life seem to be conspiring against that happening, and it's been a long time (years?) since cuddling for the sake of cuddling happened, without all of the attendant pressures and stresses of life intruding on the moment. And I miss that. I miss what it feels like to just get lost in the moment snuggling with someone, feeling them pressed against you, smelling the scent of their hair, just reveling in being close and connected. 

I know what you're thinking--"Hey, dirty old married guy. . .you really just want skeezy sex, but are trying to disguise it as something innocent." That's what I'd be thinking, too, if I were you. I assure you I'm not, but this is CL, and there are weirdos (like me), so why would you believe me?
Hmm. This may be an insurmountable obstacle. Nonetheless, let's press forward. All of you who are no longer reading might be interested. Or not. Since you're no longer reading.

I'm a 36-year-old white professional with brown hair and blue eyes; 5'9"; 150 pounds; generally pretty good smelling. Pretty good at cuddling (by my own reckoning, at least. . .perhaps that doesn't qualify as a ringing third-party endorsement). And I really want to just get lost, if even for an hour, in being close to someone, snuggling with someone, spooning, holding, etc. Life has been incredibly stressful lately, and that sort of contact sounds so relaxing, so amazingly therapeutic. . .sigh.

I know there are services for this sort of thing, and I've inquired, but haven't had any luck finding anyone who's schedule is compatible or who's close enough to make it work. And, it seems weird to pay for that sort of thing (not that I'm opposed to it), as it feels much better when the other person is just as eager to hold and be held. 

So, what am I looking for? Someone who wants the same thing (I should say a lady who wants the same thing. . .sorry, gents; nothing personal). Someone who's ideally available during the day and can host our snuggling. Someone who has a good sense of humor and will look at this the same way I do: a therapeutic modality that will give us both an escape from the stress of life for a little bit, and a chance connect with someone. 

I realize there's exactly 0 people out there who will fit that description, but there's always hope, right? Let me sweeten the pot: I WILL BRING COOKIES! Or whatever baked good tickles your pickle boat (is that a thing?). How can you say no to THAT? 

We could always meet for coffee or something beforehand, too, just to see if we feel like we want to proceed. Snuggling is intimate, and it might be weird to just show up and say, "Hey, nice to meet you, little spoon! Get over here!"

If that sounds remotely interesting, I'd love to hear from you. . .I shan't hold my breath, though, as I'm not very good at that anyway. ;)

(Oh, and for those wondering...I really just do mean cookies. Apparently, as I've learned somewhat awkwardly, that word can mean something else on CL...)

title: Re: have you ever been in true love
text: Hey I hope you catch this but yeah I have, although it's a sad ending. I meet her about one year ago while at work. You see that's the first problem don't ever fall for a woman you work with. To me she was a stunner ,from head to toe, stylish, smart , a social butterfly if you can say that. As for me I was an ordinary guy , typical when you see someone you have an attraction too. I was extremely shy, not in great shape, a loner or what I have been called a lone wolf. I think whoever said that about me didn't like me very much but whatever. So I would tense up everytime she was around me ,act like a didn't mind her at all but soon it started to get to me. I never felt a feeling like that before and have never since. For you see it was a doomed connection I know that now, she like older guys not for the money but I really do believe she like older guys. But that's nature I guess , I see that alot young girls with older guys and vice versa. So I would stare into her eyes not knowing what I was doing but I guess my co workers saw it too. It wasn't a feeling of lust or passion for me, it was a feeling of acceptance. Finally I thought , somebody who I don't have to try to make her laugh or smile just be me and go with it. I hope I described it decently, but feelings are hard to describe. So it would go on every time I saw her, until she switched store locations, deep down I knew it was my fault , I probably made her uncomfortable. I wish i could apologize to her if i ever made her feel uncomfortable. I went one working , got promoted and switched locations same job but better store I guess. I knew if I were ever to have a chance I needed to help myself become better. So with a promotion if you want to call it that, I joined a gym, started reading ,and found my passion in life because of her. I knew I couldn't become a millionaire overnight so I went to the next best thing art. I heard women dig artists type. So I went on and on I would see her come by the store every once and I while and those feelings still remained. I would try not to stare but I couldn't help it. She probably to this day thinks I'm some kind of weirdo or psycho. But I learned a lesson from all of this , I guess some people aren't meant to be no matter how you feel. Take my advice ,if she rejects you the first time move on to the next, don't wait and hope she might feel the same way.

title: ISO Young Woman with an Old Soul
text: I am looking for young woman with an old soul. Someone to talk to who would enjoy the company of an thoughtful but aging man for conversation, people watching, motorcycle rides and fun stuff around the city this spring. But please note, I want to be your friend and companion, I do not want to be your sugar daddy. I do not even want to be your daddy. I have kids that I love and am not looking for another one. I understand that if you are younger you will be less financially ready to go out and spend money, and I don't mind paying for stuff, but there's plenty of stuff that we can do around the city that doesn't really require a lot of money. But I think it's naèª°ve and condescending to think that the only way an older man and a younger woman can spend time together is by falling into either a sugar daddy relationship or a father daughter relationship. It seems sexist and ageist to think that way. I am divorced and I am happy with being single. I just like meeting different people and have dated and friended women from 18 all the way up to their mid 50s. When I was 15, my best friend was a 80 year old lady on my block who smoked Pall Mall unfiltered. I held her arm as we walked around the block so she could get her exercise. There are qualities to appreciate with everyone across the board, so please, no silly hate mail from haters who want to hate. I am very open to whom I meet and have ads that are for women closer to my own age. And I don't care much about your looks. Just be over 18, honest, kind, and sincere. As for me, I am tall, a deep thinker, a working DC professional but also dabble in art and music in my spare time. I like art, music, culture, politics, and like to get crazy just like anyone else. I am very open-minded and hope you are too. If you'd like to meet somewhere and talk about life, please say hi.

title: Answer me these questions, three
text:

I am open and adventurous, clean cut, professional, educated, and a genuine person, with a bit of a naughty side. I am better than average in the looks department. I am married, so this is strictly online and don't worry, I won't tell if you don't tell! I am willing to talk about whatever and I hope you are too. I am real, sane, normal, and plenty of fun. I have pictures if you do. Start by answering these three questions for me and then asking three of your own. And we can go back and forth and go from there.

1. If you could get on a plane and fly anywhere tomorrow, where would it be?
2. If you had a choice of one of these three and you had tickets to all three, and they were at the same time, which would you choose: concert of your favorite band, a sporting even of your favorite team, or tickets to the Kennedy Center for a play.

title: Goal: friend. Plain meaning, almost literal definition.
text:
Hello. Just looking for a potential friend. The almost literal meaning, if one can sift through life and find that. Full disclosure: not looking for anything more than friends, this is strictly platonic. Yet friends is a pretty high bar in life, I can only count on barely 2 hands who I would consider friends in my life. I value them immensely. 

I recently bought a book from Amazon by Adam Cohen, not his most recent, which I will shortly purchase I am sure. But his previous (or one of) re: FDR. I am always looking for new books to read. 
I am Christian, -- God means a lot to me and hope so for you as well. I try to spend as much time as possible outside, as time allows. What else. by most accepted standards I am intelligent. MENSA, etc. Or super intelligent, but I am blessed by God in so many ways for that. Advanced degrees, study in Europe, the whole nine years, etc. But I am humble and that is even more important to me. Who do I admire? Anyone who has used his/her life to affect good in this world, which I try to do as much as I can. I love my family and friends and just looking to talk. As I do with my friends when we go out. The art of conversation is becoming a lost art. 

I know that I will get about 50 angry replies, people will try to judge me, people will want to hook up, or give some rationalization why they will ignore my statements re:friends and want something far outside the bounds of decency. To all of those folks out there, I pray for you and hope someday you are able to live a live where you value yourself and your dignity and our of others. Here's some even more full disclosure breaking news: I'm one of those who does not "need" a relationship. I am emotionally, financially, intellectually, etc healthy. I don't need some guy to make me feel like I am worth living. That's the truth. My most important relationship is as a Christian to God, and praying for children who are suffering. That is the truth. I am blessed in so so many ways and each day I thank God. I thank God for the fact I have a beautiful house, car, food, career, health, I love my family. I thank him for their health and for my friends and for the fact it is raining now since it helps crops grow and gives us water. 

I know this post will offend many and many will take it upon themselves to write harsh, nasty replies to me. For the small chance I end up engaging with someone and meeting over coffee or tea, then it's worth the 3-4 minutes it took for me to type this :). Also, any book recommendations? Thank you for your time.
